column1: Rural Utahns deserve the same quality of life that their urban friends have including access to broadband quality medical care and good-paying jobs. I will continue to work in Congress to bring these vital services to rural Utah. https://t.co/93AudWoJP9

This mill has provided families with good incomes and generated tax dollars to help the local infrastructure. In fact this facility is the largest private employer in San Juan County. I am committed to creating new economic opportunities in rural areas. https://t.co/gl8EMWJ9pB

We'll meet throughout the year to discuss specific issues that impact Utah’s women & share an open line of communication for ideas & concerns about policies & proposals. Women bring unique & valuable perspectives to policy decisions which play a crucial part in good governance.

With a Congressional district that is over 50% female it is imperative that the female perspective is heard and given a real influence on my decisions. To better represent Utah CD-3 I'm excited to announce the creation of a Women’s Advisory Council. https://t.co/QOtvx5JOGo

But the potential threats these advancements pose to our national security to that of our allies and to consumer privacy cannot be overstated which is why I am urging my colleagues to support this legislation. https://t.co/RnAwfIGS8h

The rapid development of 5G cellular technology is another example of the resolve & innovative spirit unique to our economy. 5G will pave the way for first-of-their-kind products & will more reliably give consumers quick access to info necessary to live & work in the digital age. https://t.co/RPoNABjqIX
Happy birthday Utah! 🎉 Today our beautiful state turns 124 years young. #45thstate #happybirthdayutah #beUTAHful #utahisrad https://t.co/Y9BU653NUR

I'm proud to introduce the INVEST Act a bill that will not only effectively encourage the production of clean energy and reduce carbon emissions but invest in the American economy. More details here: https://t.co/ja0XX2xsHH

My time as mayor of Provo helped me understand how much a city and its inhabitants absolutely need reliable energy sources. Being good stewards of the environment through cleaner energy and putting money back into the pockets of Utahns need not be mutually exclusive. https://t.co/wg5csfcPIC
From my family to yours Merry Christmas! 🎄♥️ https://t.co/Sh0SbZJepU

I am grateful to Mayor Ellis as well as all of the courageous federal state and local firefighters that worked tirelessly to battle the blaze. Naming the peak ‘Miracle Mountain’ is a fitting gesture of gratitude. https://t.co/dQYx0oH6DT

Although last year’s fire season was one of our worst it brought out the best of Utah and our communities. Recognizing that he had witnessed a miracle shortly after the fire was contained Mayor Ellis reached out to me to see if we could have the peak named ‘Miracle Mountain. https://t.co/5zJFwzj136
Happy National Sock Day! 🤩 #CurtisSocks #NationalSockDay https://t.co/VYizbbtRMD

Today I’m reminded of the many blessings I’m thankful for – my loving family my wonderful community our great state of Utah and all of you. From my family to yours happy Thanksgiving. https://t.co/Ks9lr8dFCB

The Exporting Clean Energy Act will benefit US national security by strategically deploying US energy technology throughout the world as opposed to having that void filled by China and Russia while also improving environmental stewardship. https://t.co/Zp0tMG4TA9

American clean energy technology is known for being the most efficient & environmentally friendly around the world. As emissions from outside the US quickly approach 90% of world emissions - it's crucial that we're exporting as much of our own clean energy technology as possible. https://t.co/Ly44hJxsi6

I applaud the enactment of the Right to Try Act – allowing some people another option to receive the treatments they need. However this should not be the end of the conversation. Read my full release: https://t.co/qjBBN3spa9

My State Sponsored Visa Pilot Program Act will provide an additional tool to connect workers with industries that are most in need and allow visa holders the flexibility to move throughout their sponsoring state or states as employment demands and opportunities shift. https://t.co/NCc7YG3vfd

Each state has unique industries and employment opportunities and our current immigration system doesn’t fully recognize these differences. I'm excited to take another step towards fixing our broken immigration system. https://t.co/UK3NHVGQfE

As geospatial data becomes more and more integral to the planning and decision-making process at almost every agency Congress has an obligation to learn and understand this technology and how it is being used. https://t.co/FU6NT1u3B7

I am excited to announce the House GIS Working Group a nonpartisan staff-led resource available for staff to learn about geospatial policy and how data is being used in the federal government. https://t.co/RN4vA6qQTN
I'm confident that this will spur much-needed discussion on the state of our forests and how we can better manage them to reduce the risk of fire & the damage they cause. https://t.co/hFvxI84n1M

When unauthorized drones enter a wildfire area firefighters must ground helicopters & their own drones until the drone is removed. This means that far too often valuable time & resources are spent removing civilian drones instead of containing and suppressing the fire.

I'm proud to introduce the Aerial Incursion Repercussion (AIR) Safety Act w/ my friend Mr. Huffman to study how private drones flown near wildfire hinders suppression efforts & start looking at solutions that will help deter & remove unauthorized drones.

From the onset  I have advocated for transparency openness and fairness and while the current rules do not completely meet that standard I am glad that the whole country can now watch the public hearings themselves. My full statement below: https://t.co/zynnd0bKVd

I’m so grateful to live in a country & a state & a district where we have a deep reverance for our Veterans. I’d like to express to you my commitment to always appreciate & thank those who have worn the uniform for us for our freedom & our safety. Thank you & #happyveteransday🇺🇸 https://t.co/KsTT4Ariua

While this is not yet a perfect bill I'm excited to be part of real progress being made & look forward to continuing to work w/ my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to make meaningful change & advance immigration policy we can all get behind. https://t.co/2bCzfTrJMj

The “Farm Workforce Modernization Act” creates a pathway to legal status for the dedicated farmworkers who have helped provide food for our nation for decades and it ensures that Utah’s farmers and ranchers will have the year-round workforce they need to be successful.

I am pleased to lead with a bipartisan group of my colleagues a pragmatic and realistic proposal to address the immigration reforms that our agriculture sector desperately needs. https://t.co/1IiI8Qt1wk

Our relationship with Taiwan is an important alliance and we must do all we can to empower their democracy and free-market economy—I am hopeful that we can soon vote on the House floor in support of this crucial legislation. https://t.co/F7zcH4ksiW

I am so pleased to see the TAIPEI Act quickly move through the committee. It’s an honor for me to put this bill forward & I hope it’s a very clear message to our friends in Taiwan to say that friendship is reciprocated & that we appreciate their friendship over the many decades.
The TAIPEI Act is bipartisan doesn’t cost the American taxpayer a cent and it combats Chinese bullying tactics. Win win win. Read more about the bill I introduced here: https://t.co/e3dJNLJCg3

My time as a missionary for the Church of Jesus-Christ of Latter-day Saints in Taiwan provided a unique understanding of the history and culture in the region. Almost four decades later I am still committed to advocating on behalf of Taiwan and the Taiwanese people.

I introduced the "Taiwan Allies International Protection & Enhancement Initiative Act. This bipartisan bill strengthens Taiwan’s standing around the world. Our relationship w/ Taiwan is an important alliance & we must do all we can to empower their free-market economy.

I've often said that the best way to care for our public lands is to listen to those who visit the land the most - those who live work & play there. We all love our public lands want what's best for them & if we come together & actually listen to each other progress will come.
My time in San Juan County was invaluable. I had the opportunity to discuss everything from preservation to broadband and recreation permitting to better school bus routes. https://t.co/xzSFZmTKOM

Clean energy solutions & jobs are the future of the United States with clean energy powering more homes and businesses than ever before. We can work across the aisle to be better caretakers of our planet and I plan to continue the pursuit of these positive bipartisan policies.

I spoke on the floor in support of Clean Energy Week an opportunity to celebrate bipartisan support for the wide variety of clean energy sources strengthening America’s national security while also preserving our environment for future generations. https://t.co/iFR8GkO9LI

I'm happy to see members of the House Natural Resources Committee work across the aisle to streamline & reduce duplicative recreation permitting on federal lands. The SOAR Act will make it easier for more people to enjoy our public lands and the outdoors. https://t.co/Mpt5dUaHiU
And I wrote a letter to US Attorney General William Barr and Secretary Pompeo regarding Taiwan’s lack of participation in Interpol that you can read on my website:  https://t.co/XbPDLbx8c9

Additionally China flat out refuses to let Taiwan participate in Interpol and other international organizations. I've introduced the bipartisan TRAP Act to address politically-motivated abuse of the by autocracies.

Autocratic countries like Russia & China have abused Interpol databases & processes for political & other unlawful purposes such as intimidating harassing & persecuting political opponents journalists members of civil society & non-pliant members of the business community.

By not allowing development of this land we increase our energy dependence on foreign adversaries like China & Russia. The answer to climate change is not forcing us to rely on foreign fossil fuels. I vote to support local Alaska Natives not Russian oil interest.

HR 1146 would end energy development in a small portion of the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge (ANWR) in Alaska. This bill is opposed by the entire Alaska Congressional delegation Governor and local Alaska Native population. https://t.co/bRpR6Ca6Al
My bipartisan "Telehealth Innovation and Improvement Act" bill has been endorsed by Governor Gary Herbert Intermountain Healthcare and the Healthcare Leadership Council! https://t.co/SIAKCuhMrF

The partnership between local state and federal leaders is vital to the safety of Americans as well as the health of our public lands. I'm committed to working with @USDA and Utah’s local leaders to prepare for wildfires and quickly fix the damage done by past disasters.

I was pleased to be the first to deliver the news to the mayors and county officials at the Wildfire and Watershed Roundtable that Utah County will be receiving over $9.6 million in disaster relief funding to help communities affected by last year’s fires. https://t.co/0H9NOe97bY

Last month I wrote to the US Department of Agriculture Natural Resources & Environment Under Secretary James Hubbard requesting a visit to Utah. We toured fire and watershed damage and engaged with local leaders as we looked for ways to best coordinate efforts. https://t.co/pp5EDsK4n4

I am proud to introduce the Funding Local Assistance & Recovery Efforts (FLARE) Act to allow restorative work to begin more quickly by ensuring counties and cities receive retroactive payments for work they complete on EWP projects. https://t.co/WQ4O0Pk9EC

The Emergency Watershed Protection Program is an important tool to help our communities recover watersheds following disaster. However as is the case with many federal programs projects are too often hindered by bureaucratic red tape delaying important fire cleanup efforts. https://t.co/zrxNjjNyvy

Religious liberty and individual expression are not a zero sum game. There is room to protect both rights without compromising religious values. If we complicate how we treat others with criteria that they hold or live by our beliefs we will fail.  https://t.co/2WR8TLRUVr

As we look at ways to improve our environment & ensure its sustainability for future generations we must rely on science to guide our decisions. I'm confident the results of this study will help guide land managers & policymakers as we find solutions to environmental challenges.

I am proud to introduce the bipartisan SOIL Act with my friend Representative Neguse to study the importance of soil health to sequester carbon and be responsible stewards of our federal lands. https://t.co/R8ymJYtkDL
The Telehealth Innovation and Improvement Act will help incentivize healthcare organizations and providers to find innovative ways to deliver care to Utah families at a lower cost.
I’m pleased to work with willing partners on both sides of the aisle to find healthcare solutions for rural communities across Utah and around the country. https://t.co/SfFXjc1lb7

I spoke on the House floor about the medical device tax set to be implemented next year. The impact would be devastating in Utah where the MedTech industry employs thousands of Utahns and contributes approximately $5 billion annually to our economy. https://t.co/Z69A7Pt49e
It is clear why this common-sense legislation has garnered support by outdoor recreation and conservation groups alike. A more efficient permitting system benefits everyone. https://t.co/zl3TMpZIFA

The SOAR Act will make it easier for Utahns and those visiting our great state to enjoy our public lands and the outdoors. I am proud to be the Republican leader of this bipartisan effort along with Rep Haaland. https://t.co/fOOpaSr2z0

#HR1044 will create a first-come first-serve system providing certainty to workers & families & enabling US companies to flourish in a global economy as they hire the brightest people to create products services & jobs—regardless of where they were born.https://t.co/BhpwzIM33J
🇺🇸 Happy Independence Day to the best district in the best state in the best country in the whole entire world! 🇺🇸#GodBlessAmerica #IndependenceDay 📷:@heraldextra https://t.co/jTK1sY25Vb
While representing the youngest congressional district I am constantly seeking ways to improve educational opportunities for students. See full release here: https://t.co/8MeUv19o31

I am proud to partner with my colleague Congresswoman Fudge to introduce bipartisan legislation that will increase transparency and enable students to make more informed decisions for themselves and their families regarding higher education.

After meeting with state leaders local organizations and concerned citizens on my Clean Air Tour we all agreed on one thing. We want to enjoy our beautiful Utah but can't destroy it along the way. We must improve it for future generations. https://t.co/OisWJ96jat

On this day of reverence we honor & remember all the servicemen & women who have sacrificed for our country and all those who are fighting today both at home & abroad. We’re eternally grateful to all our heroes in the armed forces who fight to defend our freedom. #MemorialDay https://t.co/JyKmeYgson

I'm proud to join my colleagues in introducing the “Resilient Federal Forests Act.” This bill provides the types of fire prevention tools needed to restore health to our nation’s forests while also empowering important community safety efforts. https://t.co/wTpceqDvZk

Data indicates small businesses are at the forefront of economic growth in Utah. Small businesses added 24549 net new jobs during the last year studied. There are 287803 small businesses in Utah & they employ 46.2% of the state's private workforce! https://t.co/4k4tgeuo8m

39 years ago I was a missionary for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Taiwan. I developed a great personal appreciation for its people & their way of life. It's an honor and privilege to support our friend & partner Taiwan & highlight the bonds that connect us.

The 23.5 million people on the island represent the only democracy in the Chinese speaking world. Taiwan has come to represent many of the same principles we hold dear and serves as a proud example of democratic success in the Asia-Pacific region.

Two of my cosponsored bills H. Res. 273 and HR 2002 have passed the House without objection. These bills reaffirm our support for Taiwan and recognize the 40th anniversary of the Taiwan Relations Act. https://t.co/FHs6KGSJmV

Twice I offered a good-faith amendment that would bring transparency to the emissions produced by all countries in the agreement including foreign heavy polluters like China—both times it was shot down on a partisan basis.
I want to ensure our efforts actually improve the environment avoid damaging our economy and are based on facts not politics. https://t.co/dtvbvvJpNs
This roundtable opened my eyes to new innovative technologies that are being developed and efforts by a diverse group of Utahns to combat our unique environmental challenges. https://t.co/so3r7LWcVU
